titleStmt.title: Mad verse, sad verse, glad verse and bad verse. Cut out, and slenderly sticht together, by John Taylor. Who bids the reader either to like or dislike them, to commend them, or come mend them.
titleStmt.author: Taylor, John, 1580-1653.

notesStmt.note: A verse account of Taylor's arrest, and ultimate discharge, in London for printing pamphlets against the Parliament.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
